1.author: Homer
1.quote: …There is the heat of Love, the pulsing rush of Longing, the lover’s whisper, irresistible—magic to make the sanest man go mad.

2.author: Homer
2.quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.

3.quote: Of all creatures that can feel and think, we women are the worst treated things alive

4.quote: There is the heat of Love, the pulsing rush of Longing, the lover’s whisper, irresistible – magic to make the sanest man go mad.

5.quote: Scepticism is as much the result of knowledge, as knowledge is of scepticism.

6.quote: For a friend with an understanding heart is worth no less than a brother

7.quote: Any moment might be our last. Everything is more beautiful because we’re doomed. You will never be lovelier than you are now. We will never be here again.

10.quote: If you try to cure evil with evil you will add more pain to your fate.

12.quote: There is no greater fame for a man than that which he wins with his footwork or the skill of his hands.

15.quote: God himself helps those who dare.

16.quote: All men make mistakes, but a good man yields when he knows his course is wrong, and repairs the evil. The only crime is pride.

17.quote: Let me not then die ingloriously and without a struggle, but let me first do some great thing that shall be told among men hereafter.

18.quote: I have pondered on the causes of a life’s shipwreck. I think that our lives are worse than the mind’s quality would warrant. There are many who know virtue. We know the good, we apprehend it clearly. But we can’t bring it to achievement.
18.author: Euripides

19.quote: But he who neither thinks for himself nor learns from others, is a failure as a man.
19.author: Hesiod

20.quote: Like the generations of leaves, the lives of mortal men. Now the wind scatters the old leaves across the earth, now the living timber bursts with the new buds and spring comes round again. And so with men: as one generation comes to life, another dies away.

21.quote: To throw away an honest friend is, as it were, to throw your life away.

22.quote: Go then if you must, but remember, no matter how foolish your deeds, those who love you will love you still.

26.quote: Of all men’s miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.

28.quote: The truth is what I cherish and that’s my strength

40.quote:

the wanderer, harried for years on end

59.quote:
Take these things to heart, my son, I warn you.
All men make mistakes, it is only human.
But once the wrong is done, a man
can turn his back on folly, misfortune too,
if he tries to make amends, however low he’s fallen,
and stops his bullnecked ways. Stubbornness
brands you for stupidity – pride is a crime.

2312.quote: Imagination is the living power and prime agent of all human perception.
2312.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

2313.quote: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.
2313.author: Honore de Balzac

2314.quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while its on your plate � that's my philosophy.
2314.author: Thornton Wilder

2315.quote: Everyone has been made for some particular work, and the desire for that work has been put in every heart.
2315.author: Rumi

2316.quote: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it's best to let him run.
2316.author: Abraham Lincoln

2317.quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
2317.author: Mark Twain

2318.quote: Be the chief but never the lord.
2318.author: Lao Tzu

2319.quote: Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.

2320.quote: I may not know everything, but everything is not known yet anyway.

2321.quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.

2322.quote: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.

2323.quote: You have to take it as it happens, but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it.

2324.quote: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.
2324.author: Carl Jung

2325.quote: You cannot travel the path until you have become the path itself.
2325.author: Buddha

2326.quote: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
2326.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

2327.quote: Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground.
2327.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2328.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
2328.author: William White

2329.quote: Limitations live only in our minds. But if we use our imaginations, our possibilities become limitless.

2330.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.
2330.author: Chinese proverb

2331.quote: When you lose, don't lose the lesson.

2332.quote: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
2332.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

2333.quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.

2334.quote: All the great performers I have worked with are fuelled by a personal dream.

2335.quote: It's so simple to be wise. Just think of something stupid to say and then don't say it.

2336.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.

2337.quote: You can adopt the attitude there is nothing you can do, or you can see the challenge as your call to action.

2338.quote: An obstacle may be either a stepping stone or a stumbling block.

2339.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but ... the last of the human freedoms � to choose ones attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose ones own way.
2339.author: Victor Frankl

2340.quote: I think and that is all that I am.
2340.author: Wayne Dyer

2341.quote: The greatest barrier to success is the fear of failure.

2342.quote: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.

2343.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.
2343.author: Chinese proverb

2344.quote: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.

2346.quote: If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?

2347.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

2348.quote: We choose our destiny in the way we treat others.

2349.quote: There are things so deep and complex that only intuition can reach it in our stage of development as human beings.

2350.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavours to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

2351.quote: The beginning of wisdom is found in doubting; by doubting we come to the question, and by seeking we may come upon the truth.

2356.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.

2358.quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.

2359.quote: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.

2360.quote: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends.

2361.quote: Feeling and longing are the motive forces behind all human endeavor and human creations.

2370.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and the every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.

2371.quote: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.

2372.quote: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.

2375.quote: We do what we do because we believe.

2380.quote: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.

2381.quote: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.

2384.quote: To change ones life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.

2385.quote: I have done my best: that is about all the philosophy of living one needs.

2386.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

2387.quote: If you let go a little, you will have a little peace. If you let go a lot, you will have a lot of peace.

2388.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy, too.
2388.author: Mark Twain

2389.quote: Character develops itself in the stream of life.

2390.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but ... the last of the human freedoms � to choose ones attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose ones own way.
2390.author: Victor Frankl

2391.quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.

2392.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
2392.author: Andr� Gide

2393.quote: The only real valuable thing is intuition.

2394.quote: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what a man or woman is able to do that counts.

2395.quote: The steeper the mountain the harder the climb the better the view from the finishing line

2396.quote: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.

2398.quote: I have done my best: that is about all the philosophy of living one needs.
2398.author: Lin-yutang

2399.quote: Forgiveness is choosing to love. It is the first skill of self-giving love.

2400.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding.

2404.quote: Time is not a measure the length of a day or month or year but more a measure of what you have accomplished.

2406.quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.

2407.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.

2408.quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.

2409.quote: When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you.

2410.quote: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.

2417.quote: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.

2419.quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.

2420.quote: You are the only person on Earth who can use your ability.

2421.quote: Don't let what you can't do stop you from doing what you can do.

2422.quote: Complaining doesn't change a thing only taking action does.

2423.quote: Life a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of the future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.

2424.quote: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.

2425.quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.

2430.quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.

2431.quote: The world turns aside to let any man pass who knows where he is going.

2432.quote: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything hes got.

2433.quote: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
2433.author: Kahlil Gibran

2434.quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a day of work.

2435.quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.

2436.quote: It isn't where you come from, it's where you're going that counts.

2437.quote: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.
2437.author: Lao Tzu

2438.quote: Truth, and goodness, and beauty are but different faces of the same all.

2439.quote: All I can say about life is, Oh God, enjoy it!

2440.quote: Trust your hunches. They're usually based on facts filed away just below the conscious level.

2441.quote: The day is already blessed, find peace within it.

2442.quote: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
2442.author: Chinese proverb

2451.quote: I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.

2452.quote: The most decisive actions of our life... are most often unconsidered actions.

2453.quote: As we grow as unique persons, we learn to respect the uniqueness of others.

2454.quote: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.
2454.author: Robert Schuller

2455.quote: Conflict is the gadfly of thought. It stirs us to observation and memory. It instigates to invention. It shocks us out of sheeplike passivity, and sets us at noting and contriving.

2456.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.

2457.quote: No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.

2458.quote: Those who are blessed with the most talent don't necessarily outperform everyone else. It's the people with follow-through who excel.

2459.quote: They can do all because they think they can.
2459.author: Virgil

2460.quote: It isn't where you come from, it's where you're going that counts.
2460.author: Ella Fitzgerald

2461.quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.
2461.author: Buddha

2462.quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
2462.author: Carl Jung

2463.quote: It is the quality of our work which will please God, not the quantity.
2463.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2464.quote: Try and fail, but don't fail to try.

2465.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not of.

2466.quote: The happy and efficient people in this world are those who accept trouble as a normal detail of human life and resolve to capitalize it when it comes along.
2466.author: H. Bertram Lewis

2467.quote: I am not bothered by the fact that I am unknown. I am bothered when I do not know others.

2468.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
2468.author: Epictetus

2469.quote: The ladder of success is never crowded at the top.

2470.quote: You can do what's reasonable or you can decide what's possible.

2471.quote: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.

2472.quote: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
2472.author: H. Jackson Browne

2473.quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
2473.author: Bruce Lee

2474.quote: I allow my intuition to lead my path.
2474.author: Manuel Puig

2475.quote: Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.

2476.quote: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us, Something is out of tune.
2476.author: Carl Jung

2477.quote: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
2477.author: Abraham Maslow

2478.quote: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.
2478.author: Epictetus

2479.quote: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
2479.author: Percy Shelley

2480.quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
2480.author: Buddha

2481.quote: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
2481.author: Albert Einstein

2482.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
2482.author: Albert Schweitzer

2483.quote: We are Divine enough to ask and we are important enough to receive.
2483.author: Wayne Dyer

2484.quote: If you kick a stone in anger, you'll hurt your own foot.
2484.author: Korean proverb

2485.quote: Put your future in good hands � your own.

2486.quote: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
2486.author: Lao Tzu

2487.quote: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
2487.author: Orison Marden

2488.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as ones own in the midst of abundance.

2489.quote: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
2489.author: Helen Keller

2490.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
2490.author: Margaret Mead

2491.quote: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
2491.author: Lao Tzu

2492.quote: The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
2492.author: Charles DeLint

2493.quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
2493.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

2494.quote: The happiness that is genuinely satisfying is accompanied by the fullest exercise of our faculties and the fullest realization of the world in which we live.
2494.author: Bertrand Russell

2495.quote: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
2495.author: Douglas Adams

2496.quote: Giving up doesn't always mean you are weak. Sometimes it means that you are strong enough to let go.

2497.quote: The greatest antidote to insecurity and the sense of fear is compassion � it brings one back to the basis of one's inner strength
2497.author: Dalai Lama

2498.quote: The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it.
2498.author: Norman Schwarzkopf

2499.quote: If we could learn to like ourselves, even a little, maybe our cruelties and angers might melt away.
2499.author: John Steinbeck

2500.quote: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
2500.author: Brendan Francis

2501.quote: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little � do what you can.
2501.author: Sydney Smith

2502.quote: I may not know everything, but everything is not known yet anyway.
2502.author: Byron Pulsifer

2503.quote: He who obtains has little. He who scatters has much.
2503.author: Lao Tzu

2504.quote: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
2504.author: Dhammapada

2505.quote: Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.
2505.author: Buddha

2506.quote: Deep listening is miraculous for both listener and speaker.When someone receives us with open-hearted, non-judging, intensely interested listening, our spirits expand.
2506.author: Sue Patton Thoele

2507.quote: A true friend is the most precious of all possessions and the one we take the least thought about acquiring.
2507.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

2508.quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
2508.author: Ralph Emerson

2509.quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
2509.author: Winston Churchill

2510.quote: As the rest of the world is walking out the door, your best friends are the ones walking in.

2511.quote: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past, wisdom is of the future.
2511.author: Vernon Cooper

2512.quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
2512.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

2513.quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
2513.author: Washington Irving

2514.quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
2514.author: Carl Jung

2515.quote: The universe is made of stories, not atoms.
2515.author: Muriel Rukeyser

2516.quote: It is on our failures that we base a new and different and better success.
2516.author: Havelock Ellis

2517.quote: Success means having the courage, the determination, and the will to become the person you believe you were meant to be.
2517.author: George Sheehan

2518.quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer, and practice it.
2518.author: Richard Bach

2519.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and the every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
2519.author: Anne Bronte

2520.quote: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
2520.author: Richard Bach

2521.quote: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
2521.author: Frank Wright

2522.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
2522.author: Confucius

2523.quote: We cannot change our memories, but we can change their meaning and the power they have over us.
2523.author: David Seamans

2524.quote: Always tell the truth. That way, you don't have to remember what you said.
2524.author: Mark Twain

2525.quote: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
2525.author: Albert Schweitzer

2526.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
2526.author: Thomas Jefferson

2527.quote: You can do it if you believe you can!
2527.author: Napoleon Hill

2528.quote: The most dangerous way to lose time is not to spend it having fun, but to spend it doing fake work. When you spend time having fun, you know you're being self-indulgent.
2528.author: Paul Graham

2529.quote: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
2529.author: Napoleon Hill

2530.quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
2530.author: Will Durant

2531.quote: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.
2531.author: Mother Teresa

2532.quote: A lot of people give up just before theyre about to make it. You know you never know when that next obstacle is going to be the last one.
2532.author: Chuck Norris

2533.quote: Sometimes the biggest act of courage is a small one.
2533.author: Lauren Raffo

2534.quote: He who experiences the unity of life sees his own Self in all beings, and all beings in his own Self, and looks on everything with an impartial eye.
2534.author: Buddha

2535.quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
2535.author: Rumi

2536.quote: The moment one gives close attention to anything, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
2536.author: Henry Miller

2537.quote: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
2537.author: Richard Bach

2538.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
2538.author: Epictetus

2539.quote: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.

3249.author: Marcus Aurelius

3250.quote: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
3250.author: Alexander Pope

3251.quote: Respect is not something that you can ask for, buy or borrow. Respect is what you earn from each person no matter their background or status.
3251.author: Byron Pulsifer

3252.quote: Things do not change; we change.
3252.author: Henry Thoreau

3253.quote: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
3253.author: Ralph Marston

3254.quote: We must learn our limits. We are all something, but none of us are everything.
3254.author: Blaise Pascal

3255.quote: You have to think anyway, so why not think big?
3255.author: Donald Trump

3256.quote: The harder you fall, the higher you bounce.

3257.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
3257.author: Og Mandino

3258.quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
3258.author: Ken S. Keyes

3259.quote: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.

3260.quote: Yesterdays home runs don't win today's games.
3260.author: Babe Ruth

3261.quote: Happiness does not come from having much, but from being attached to little.
3261.author: Cheng Yen

3262.quote: Everyone has been made for some particular work, and the desire for that work has been put in every heart.
3262.author: Rumi

3263.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
3263.author: William James

3264.quote: Learn wisdom from the ways of a seedling. A seedling which is never hardened off through stressful situations will never become a strong productive plant.
3264.author: Stephen Sigmund

3265.quote: No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.
3265.author: Helen Keller

3266.quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
3266.author: Charles R. Swindoll

3267.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.
3267.author: Chinese proverb

3268.quote: The poor man is not he who is without a cent, but he who is without a dream.
3268.author: Harry Kemp

3269.quote: All men have a sweetness in their life. That is what helps them go on. It is towards that they turn when they feel too worn out.
3269.author: Albert Camus

3270.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
3270.author: Frank Tyger

3271.quote: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.

3272.quote: Meditation brings wisdom; lack of mediation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what hold you back, and choose the path that leads to wisdom.

3273.quote: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
3273.author: Charles Perkhurst

3274.quote: What we see is mainly what we look for.

3275.quote: It is impossible to feel grateful and depressed in the same moment.
3275.author: Naomi Williams

3276.quote: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
3276.author: Anatole France

3277.quote: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
3277.author: Leonardo da Vinci

3278.quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.

3279.quote: The worst bankrupt in the world is the person who has lost his enthusiasm.
3279.author: H. W. Arnold

3280.quote: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.
3280.author: Mortimer Adler

3281.quote: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
3281.author: Richard Bach

3282.quote: He that never changes his opinions, never corrects his mistakes, and will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
3282.author: Tryon Edwards

3283.quote: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
3283.author: Wayne Dyer

3284.quote: In order to win, you must expect to win.
3284.author: Richard Bach

3285.quote: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.

3286.quote: Opportunity is missed by most because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

3287.quote: Give thanks for the rain of life that propels us to reach new horizons.
3287.author: Byron Pulsifer

3288.quote: A beautiful thing is never perfect.

3290.quote: We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light.

3291.quote: Imagination disposes of everything; it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
3291.author: Blaise Pascal

3292.quote: There are no failures. Just experiences and your reactions to them.
3292.author: Tom Krause

3293.quote: As we grow as unique persons, we learn to respect the uniqueness of others.
3293.author: Robert Schuller

3294.quote: Every great mistake has a halfway moment, a split second when it can be recalled and perhaps remedied.

3295.quote: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.

3296.quote: Don't let today's disappointments cast a shadow on tomorrow's dreams.

3297.quote: To listen well is as powerful a means of communication and influence as to talk well.

3298.quote: Imagination is the living power and prime agent of all human perception.
3298.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

3299.quote: When you don't know what you believe, everything becomes an argument. Everything is debatable. But when you stand for something, decisions are obvious.

3300.quote: You only lose what you cling to.

3301.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
3301.author: George Sand

3302.quote: Happiness is found in doing, not merely possessing.
3302.author: Napoleon Hill

3303.quote: Live through feeling and you will live through love. For feeling is the language of the soul, and feeling is truth.
3303.author: Matt Zotti

3304.quote: He who is contented is rich.
3304.author: Lao Tzu

3305.quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
3305.author: Richard Bach

3306.quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
3306.author: Lao Tzu

3307.quote: Reason and free inquiry are the only effectual agents against error.
3307.author: Thomas Jefferson

3308.quote: Moments of complete apathy are the best for new creations.
3308.author: Philip Breedveld

3309.quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
3309.author: Bernard Shaw

3310.quote: You can't choose up sides on a round world.
3310.author: Wayne Dyer

3311.quote: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.
3311.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

3312.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
3312.author: Marcus Aurelius

3313.quote: By believing passionately in something that does not yet exist, we create it.
3313.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

3314.quote: If one is estranged from oneself, then one is estranged from others too. If one is out of touch with oneself, then one cannot touch others.
3314.author: Anne Lindbergh

3315.quote: You got to be careful if you don't know where you're going, because you might not get there.
3315.author: Yogi Berra

3316.quote: See the positive side, the potential, and make an effort.
3316.author: Dalai Lama

3317.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.

3318.quote: By accepting yourself and being fully what you are, your presence can make others happy.
3318.author: Jane Roberts

3319.quote: Never deny a diagnosis, but do deny the negative verdict that may go with it.

3320.quote: The really unhappy person is the one who leaves undone what they can do, and starts doing what they don't understand; no wonder they come to grief.
3320.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

3321.quote: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
3321.author: Lawrence Peter

3322.quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.
3322.author: Everett Dirksen

3323.quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
3323.author: Alfred Tennyson

3324.quote: Life is movement-we breathe, we eat, we walk, we move!
3324.author: John Pierrakos

3325.quote: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.
3325.author: Buddha

3326.quote: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
3326.author: Wayne Dyer

3327.quote: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands.
3327.author: Robert M. Pirsig

3328.quote: Why worry about tomorrow, when today is all we have?

3329.quote: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
3329.author: A. A. Milne

3330.quote: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.

3331.quote: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.

3332.quote: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.

3333.quote: We know the truth, not only by the reason, but by the heart.

3334.quote: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
3334.author: Holmes

3335.quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
3335.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

3337.quote: The best thing in every noble dream is the dreamer...
3337.author: Moncure Conway

3338.quote: Everyone smiles in the same language.

3339.quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
3339.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

3340.quote: Take heed: you do not find what you do not seek.
3340.author: English proverb

3341.quote: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?

3344.quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
3344.author: Bernadette Devlin

3345.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
3345.author: Frank Tyger

3346.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on man unless they act.

3347.quote: If you propose to speak, always ask yourself, is it true, is it necessary, is it kind.

3348.quote: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.
3348.author: Blaise Pascal

3349.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.

3354.quote: When fate hands us a lemon, lets try to make lemonade.

3356.quote: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.

3361.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

3366.quote: Things turn out best for those who make the best of the way things turn out.

3369.quote: You can be what you want to be. You have the power within and we will help you always.

3370.quote: The thoughts we choose to think are the tools we use to paint the canvas of our lives.

3371.quote: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.

3374.quote: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.

3377.quote: The undertaking of a new action brings new strength.

3378.quote: What you see depends on what you're looking for.

3380.quote: I gave my life to become the person I am right now. Was it worth it?

3383.quote: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.

3384.quote: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.

3387.quote: When you doubt your power, you give power to your doubt.

3388.quote: You may only be someone in the world, but to someone else, you may be the world.

3392.quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.

3400.quote: I think and that is all that I am.

3401.quote: Don't leave a stone unturned. It's always something, to know you have done the most you could.
3401.author: Charles Dickens

3402.quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
3402.author: Albert Einstein

3403.quote: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
3403.author: Holmes

3404.quote: If one does not know to which port is sailing, no wind is favorable.

3405.quote: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.

3406.quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
3406.author: Aristotle

3407.quote: Id rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
3407.author: Lucille Ball

3408.quote: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your reactions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.

3409.author: William James

3410.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
3410.author: Buddha

3411.quote: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
3411.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

3412.quote: We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts. With our thoughts, we make the world.
3412.author: Buddha

3413.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
3413.author: Margaret Mead

3414.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
3414.author: Walt Disney

3415.quote: The odds of hitting your target go up dramatically when you aim at it.
3415.author: Mal Pancoast

3416.quote: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.
3416.author: Dalai Lama

3417.quote: I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.
3417.author: Henry David Thoreau

3418.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
3418.author: Helen Keller

3419.quote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
3419.author: Bruce Lee

3420.quote: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
3420.author: Lao Tzu

3422.quote: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
3422.author: Ralph Marston

3423.quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
3423.author: Zig Ziglar

3424.quote: There is no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love; theres only scarcity of resolve to make it happen.

3425.quote: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.

3426.quote: The happy and efficient people in this world are those who accept trouble as a normal detail of human life and resolve to capitalize it when it comes along.

3427.author: Ovid

3428.quote: Arrogance and rudeness are training wheels on the bicycle of life � for weak people who cannot keep their balance without them.

3429.quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
3429.author: Richard Bach

3430.quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.

3431.quote: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.
3431.author: Edwin Markham

3432.quote: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.

3433.quote: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
3433.author: Carl Jung

3434.quote: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
3434.author: Yogi Berra

3435.quote: It is only when the mind and character slumber that the dress can be seen.
3435.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

3436.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
3436.author: Walt Disney

3437.quote: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.
3437.author: Blaise Pascal

3438.quote: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.
3438.author: Robert Southey

3439.quote: Each time we face a fear, we gain strength, courage, and confidence in the doing.

3440.quote: We cannot direct the wind but we can adjust the sails.

3441.quote: This world, after all our science and sciences, is still a miracle; wonderful, inscrutable, magical and more, to whosoever will think of it.
3441.author: Thomas Carlyle

3442.quote: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
3442.author: Richard Bach

3443.quote: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.
3443.author: Tony Robbins

3444.quote: Id rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
3444.author: Lucille Ball

3445.quote: Sincerity is the way of Heaven. The attainment of sincerity is the way of men.
3445.author: Confucius

3446.quote: I always wanted to be somebody, but I should have been more specific.
3446.author: Lily Tomlin

3447.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, nor touched... but are felt in the heart.
3447.author: Helen Keller

3448.quote: You can't trust without risk but neither can you live in a cocoon.
3448.author: Byron Pulsifer

3449.quote: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
3449.author: Wayne Dyer

3450.quote: All I can say about life is, Oh God, enjoy it!
3450.author: Bob Newhart

3451.quote: The secret of joy in work is contained in one word � excellence. To know how to do something well is to enjoy it.
3451.author: Pearl Buck

3452.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
3452.author: George Sand

3453.quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
3453.author: Henri Bergson

3455.quote: Don't think of it as failure. Think of it as time-released success.
3455.author: Robert Orben

3456.quote: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
3456.author: Richard Bach

3457.quote: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
3457.author: Albert Einstein

3458.quote: Meaning is not what you start with but what you end up with.
3458.author: Peter Elbow

3459.quote: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
3459.author: Mohandas Gandhi

3460.quote: The most formidable weapon against errors of every kind is reason.
3460.author: Thomas Paine

3461.quote: I don't believe in failure. It is not failure if you enjoyed the process.
3461.author: Oprah Winfrey

3462.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
3462.author: Helen Keller

3463.quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
3463.author: Elbert Hubbard

3464.quote: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
3464.author: Jim Rohn

3465.quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
3465.author: Oprah Winfrey

3466.quote: A good rest is half the work.

3467.quote: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.
3467.author: Brian Tracy

3468.quote: He who is contented is rich.
3468.author: Lao Tzu

3469.quote: God always takes the simplest way.
3469.author: Albert Einstein

3470.quote: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
3470.author: Goethe

3471.quote: Formula for success: under promise and over deliver.
3471.author: Tom Peters

3473.quote: The greatest part of our happiness depends on our dispositions, not our circumstances.
3473.author: Martha Washington

3474.quote: Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that.
3474.author: Jean Lacordaire

3475.quote: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.
3475.author: Ray Bradbury

3476.quote: What matters is the value we've created in our lives, the people we've made happy and how much we've grown as people.
3476.author: Daisaku Ikeda

3478.quote: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
3478.author: Pema Chodron

3479.quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves � there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
3479.author: Joan Didion

3480.quote: Success means having the courage, the determination, and the will to become the person you believe you were meant to be.
3480.author: George Sheehan

3481.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
3481.author: Bruce Lee

3482.quote: Iron rusts from disuse; water loses its purity from stagnation... even so does inaction sap the vigour of the mind.
3482.author: Leonardo da Vinci

3483.quote: A good rest is half the work.

3484.quote: You won't skid if you stay in a rut.
3484.author: Kin Hubbard

3485.quote: We must become the change we want to see.
3485.author: Mahatma Gandhi

3486.quote: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
3486.author: Publilius Syrus

3487.quote: Be not afraid of greatness: some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
3487.author: William Shakespeare

3488.quote: Change in all things is sweet.
3488.author: Aristotle

4210.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honourable but more useful than a life spent in doing nothing.

4324.quote: Truth is powerful and it prevails.

4406.quote: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.

4412.quote: A man of ability and the desire to accomplish something can do anything.

4414.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.
4414.author: Chinese proverb

4415.quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.

4416.quote: I am of the opinion that my life belongs to the community, and as long as I live it is my privilege to do for it whatever I can.

4417.author: Brendan Francis

4418.quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?

4419.quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
4419.author: Albert Camus

4420.quote: There are no failures � just experiences and your reactions to them.
4420.author: Tom Krause

4421.quote: Transformation does not start with some one else changing you; transformation is an inner self reworking of what you are now to what you will be.
4421.author: Byron Pulsifer

4422.quote: From small beginnings come great things.

4423.quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
4423.author: Mother Teresa

4424.quote: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
4424.author: Carl Jung

4425.quote: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.
4425.author: Lucille Ball

4426.quote: Well done is better than well said.

4427.quote: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
4427.author: Abraham Lincoln

4428.author: Alfred Sheinwold

4429.author: Chuang Tzu

4430.quote: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon, and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.

4431.quote: I never worry about action, but only inaction.

4433.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones weve been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
4433.author: Barack Obama

4434.quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
4434.author: Aristotle

4435.quote: We all have problems. The way we solve them is what makes us different.

4436.quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
4436.author: Cavour

4437.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the paren't of all the others.
4437.author: Cicero

4438.quote: To be happy is to be able to become aware of oneself without fright.
4438.author: Walter Benjamin

4439.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
4439.author: Og Mandino

4440.quote: In skating over thin ice our safety is in our speed.

4441.quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.

4443.quote: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
4443.author: Richard Bach

4444.quote: What you give is what you get.
4444.author: Byron Pulsifer

4445.quote: The person who lives life fully, glowing with life's energy, is the person who lives a successful life.
4445.author: Daisaku Ikeda

4446.quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
4446.author: Aristotle

4447.quote: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!
4447.author: Charlotte Gilman

4448.quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
4448.author: Benjamin Disraeli

4450.quote: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice.
4450.author: Oprah Winfrey

4451.quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.

4452.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
4452.author: Andr� Gide

4453.quote: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
4453.author: Confucius

4454.quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
4454.author: Horace

4455.quote: The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.
4455.author: Ben Stein

4456.quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
4456.author: Coco Chanel

4457.quote: While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity.
4457.author: Publilius Syrus

4458.quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
4458.author: Will Durant

4459.quote: You only lose what you cling to.
4459.author: Buddha

4461.quote: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
4461.author: Alexander Pope

4462.quote: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
4462.author: Napoleon Hill

4463.quote: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
4463.author: Napoleon Hill

4464.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
4464.author: Mohandas Gandhi

4465.quote: Success means having the courage, the determination, and the will to become the person you believe you were meant to be.
4465.author: George Sheehan

4466.quote: We are either progressing or retrograding all the while. There is no such thing as remaining stationary in this life.
4466.author: James Freeman Clarke

4467.quote: Action will remove the doubts that theory cannot solve.
4467.author: Tehyi Hsieh

4468.quote: Adversity isn't set against you to fail; adversity is a way to build your character so that you can succeed over and over again through perseverance.
4468.author: Byron Pulsifer

4469.quote: Why worry about things you can�t control when you can keep yourself busy controlling the things that depend on you?

4470.quote: Spring is a time for rebirth and the fulfilment of new life.
4470.author: Byron Pulsifer

4471.quote: In the end we retain from our studies only that which we practically apply.
4471.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

4472.quote: Only do what your heart tells you.
4472.author: Princess Diana

4473.quote: Responsibility is not inherited, it is a choice that everyone needs to make at some point in their life.
4473.author: Byron Pulsifer

4474.quote: You cannot have what you do not want.
4474.author: John Acosta

4475.quote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
4475.author: Lao Tzu

4476.quote: An optimist is a person who sees a green light everywhere, while the pessimist sees only the red spotlight... The truly wise person is colour-blind.
4476.author: Albert Schweitzer

4477.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
4477.author: Og Mandino

4478.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
4478.author: Lao Tzu

4479.quote: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
4479.author: Denis Waitley

4480.quote: Allow the world to live as it chooses, and allow yourself to live as you choose.
4480.author: Richard Bach

4481.quote: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
4481.author: Franklin Roosevelt

4482.quote: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
4482.author: Jim Rohn

4483.quote: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
4483.author: Dhammapada

4484.quote: Don't miss all the beautiful colors of the rainbow looking for that pot of gold.

4485.quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.
4485.author: Richard Bach

4486.quote: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
4486.author: Richard Bach

4487.quote: Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgement of others.
4487.author: Wayne Dyer

4488.quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
4488.author: Lao Tzu

4489.quote: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
4489.author: Anatole France

4490.quote: When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid.
4490.author: Audre Lorde

4491.quote: Imagination is not a talent of some men but is the health of every man.
4491.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

4492.quote: If the shoe doesn't fit, must we change the foot?
4492.author: Gloria Steinem

4493.quote: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us, Something is out of tune.
4493.author: Carl Jung

4494.quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
4494.author: Mahatma Gandhi

4495.quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
4495.author: Ken S. Keyes

4496.quote: He that respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
4496.author: Henry Longfellow

4497.quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.
4497.author: Buddha

4498.quote: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
4498.author: Denis Waitley

4499.quote: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
4499.author: Lao Tzu

4500.quote: A smile is a light in the window of your face to show your heart is at home.

4501.quote: Time you enjoyed wasting was not wasted.
4501.author: John Lennon

4502.quote: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
4502.author: Jim Rohn

4503.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
4503.author: Francis Bacon

4504.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
4504.author: Bruce Lee

4505.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavours to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
4505.author: Henry David Thoreau

4506.quote: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.
4506.author: Gordon Hinckley

4507.quote: To climb steep hills requires a slow pace at first.
4507.author: William Shakespeare

4509.quote: If you light a lamp for somebody, it will also brighten your path.
4509.author: Buddha

4510.quote: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
4510.author: Wayne Dyer

4511.quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
4511.author: Peter Drucker

4512.quote: Everyone smiles in the same language.

4513.quote: A good rest is half the work.

4514.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
4514.author: William Shakespeare

4515.quote: Not every difficult and dangerous thing is suitable for training, but only that which is conducive to success in achieving the object of our effort.
4515.author: Epictetus

4516.quote: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. And today? Today is a gift that's why they call it the present.

4517.quote: Your ability to learn faster than your competition is your only sustainable competitive advantage.
4517.author: Arie de Gues

4518.quote: When deeds speak, words are nothing.
4518.author: African proverb

4519.quote: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.
4519.author: John Dewey

4520.quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.
4520.author: Richard Bach

4521.quote: Trust your own instinct. Your mistakes might as well be your own, instead of someone elses.
4521.author: Billy Wilder

4522.quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
4522.author: Robert Kennedy

4523.quote: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
4523.author: Brian Tracy

4524.quote: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
4524.author: Mohandas Gandhi

4525.quote: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
4525.author: Douglas Adams

4527.quote: Consider how hard it is to change yourself and you'll understand what little chance you have in trying to change others.
4527.author: Jacob Braude

4528.quote: He that never changes his opinions, never corrects his mistakes, and will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
4528.author: Tryon Edwards

4529.quote: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
4529.author: Bernice Reagon

4530.quote: Arriving at one point is the starting point to another.
4530.author: John Dewey

4531.quote: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
4531.author: Abraham Lincoln

4532.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy, too.
4532.author: Mark Twain

4533.quote: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
4533.author: Winston Churchill

4534.quote: Many people think of prosperity that concerns money only to forget that true prosperity is of the mind.
4534.author: Byron Pulsifer

4535.quote: The difficulties of life are intended to make us better, not bitter.

4536.quote: Slow down and enjoy life. It's not only the scenery you miss by going too fast � you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.
4536.author: Eddie Cantor

4537.quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
4537.author: Richard Bach

4538.quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
4538.author: John Muir

4539.quote: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
4539.author: Mother Teresa

4540.quote: The most dangerous way to lose time is not to spend it having fun, but to spend it doing fake work. When you spend time having fun, you know you're being self-indulgent.
4540.author: Paul Graham

4541.quote: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgement.
4541.author: Ralph Marston

4542.quote: Begin to weave and God will give you the thread.
4542.author: German proverb

4543.quote: Knowledge has three degrees � opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
4543.author: Plotinus

4544.quote: Impossibilities are merely things which we have not yet learned.
4544.author: Charles Chesnutt

4545.quote: Don't be pushed by your problems; be led by your dreams.

4546.quote: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
4546.author: Mary Kay Ash

4547.quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
4547.author: Buddha

4548.quote: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
4548.author: John Lennon

4549.quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
4549.author: Immanuel Kant

4550.quote: The greatest antidote to insecurity and the sense of fear is compassion � it brings one back to the basis of one's inner strength
4550.author: Dalai Lama

4551.quote: Courage is the discovery that you may not win, and trying when you know you can lose.

4552.quote: To know oneself is to study oneself in action with another person.
4552.author: Bruce Lee

4553.quote: Many people think of prosperity that concerns money only to forget that true prosperity is of the mind.
4553.author: Byron Pulsifer

4554.quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
4554.author: Epictetus

4555.quote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
4555.author: Og Mandino

4556.quote: From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
4556.author: Sigmund Freud

4557.quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
4557.author: Thornton Wilder

4558.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
4558.author: John F. Kennedy

4559.quote: Faith in oneself is the best and safest course.
4559.author: Michelangelo

4560.quote: The minute you settle for less than you deserve, you get even less than you settled for.
4560.author: Maureen Dowd

4562.quote: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.
4562.author: Wayne Dyer

4563.quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world.
4563.author: Helen Keller

4564.quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
4564.author: Benjamin Franklin

4565.quote: Meditation is the dissolution of thoughts in eternal awareness or Pure consciousness without objectification, knowing without thinking, merging finitude in infinity.
4565.author: Voltaire

4566.quote: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
4566.author: Mary Kay Ash

4567.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
4567.author: Frank Tyger

4568.quote: If you kick a stone in anger, you'll hurt your own foot.
4568.author: Korean proverb

4569.quote: Never miss an opportunity to make others happy, even if you have to leave them alone in order to do it.

4570.quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.

4571.quote: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
4571.author: Victoria Holt

4572.quote: Good luck is another name for tenacity of purpose.
4572.author: Ralph Emerson

4573.quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
4573.author: Buddha

4574.quote: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
4574.author: Mahatma Gandhi

4575.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
4575.author: Oscar Wilde

4576.quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
4576.author: Tony Robbins

4577.quote: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
4577.author: Albert Schweitzer

4578.quote: Skill to do comes of doing.
4578.author: Ralph Emerson

4579.quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.

4580.quote: Meaning is not what you start with but what you end up with.
4580.author: Peter Elbow

4581.quote: Numberless are the worlds wonders, but none more wonderful than man.
4581.author: Sophocles

4582.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
4582.author: Jim Rohn

4583.quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.

4584.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds you plant.
4584.author: Robert Stevenson

4585.quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
4585.author: Albert Einstein

4586.quote: Formula for success: under promise and over deliver.
4586.author: Tom Peters

4587.quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
4587.author: Henry Ward Beecher

4588.quote: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
4588.author: Rabbi Hillel

4589.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
4589.author: Marie Curie

4590.quote: One who gains strength by overcoming obstacles possesses the only strength which can overcome adversity.
4590.author: Albert Schweitzer

4591.quote: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.
4591.author: John Lennon

4592.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
4592.author: Bernard Shaw

4593.quote: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was within me an invincible summer.
4593.author: Albert Camus

4594.quote: Happiness cannot be travelled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
4594.author: Denis Waitley

4595.quote: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
4595.author: Jim Rohn

4596.quote: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.
4596.author: Robert Schuller

4597.quote: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
4597.author: Etty Hillesum

4598.quote: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
4598.author: Bernice Reagon

4599.quote: With courage you will dare to take risks, have the strength to be compassionate, and the wisdom to be humble. Courage is the foundation of integrity.
4599.author: Keshavan Nair

4600.quote: To want to be what one can be is purpose in life.
4600.author: Cynthia Ozick

4601.quote: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
4601.author: Charles Dubois

4603.quote: As we grow as unique persons, we learn to respect the uniqueness of others.
4603.author: Robert Schuller

4604.quote: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness.
4604.author: Oliver Holmes

4605.quote: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains.
4605.author: Ralph Emerson

4606.quote: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
4606.author: John Lennon

4607.quote: A man of ability and the desire to accomplish something can do anything.
4607.author: Donald Kircher

4608.quote: Everything in the universe goes by indirection. There are no straight lines.
4608.author: Ralph Emerson

4609.quote: The greatest part of our happiness depends on our dispositions, not our circumstances.
4609.author: Martha Washington

4610.quote: You have to take it as it happens, but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it.
4610.author: Old German proverb

4611.quote: I know but one freedom and that is the freedom of the mind.
4611.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

4612.quote: Change your words. Change your world.

4613.quote: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
4613.author: Lao Tzu

4614.quote: The most successful people are those who are good at plan B.
4614.author: James Yorke

4615.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
4615.author: Seneca

4616.quote: The highest stage in moral ure at which we can arrive is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
4616.author: Charles Darwin

4617.quote: Staying in one place is the best path to be taken over and surpassed by many.
4617.author: Byron Pulsifer

4618.quote: The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
4618.author: Charles DeLint

4619.quote: A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be.
4619.author: Albert Einstein

4620.quote: You are the only person on earth who can use your ability.
4620.author: Zig Ziglar

4621.quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
4621.author: Richard Bach

4622.quote: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.
4622.author: E. M. Forster

4623.quote: The true way to render ourselves happy is to love our work and find in it our pleasure.
4623.author: Francoise de Motteville

4625.quote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
4625.author: Nikola Tesla

4626.quote: Worry gives a small thing a big shadow.

4627.quote: Those who are blessed with the most talent don't necessarily outperform everyone else. It's the people with follow-through who excel.
4627.author: Mary Kay Ash

4628.quote: An obstacle may be either a stepping stone or a stumbling block.

4629.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
4629.author: Mohandas Gandhi

4630.quote: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
4630.author: Albert Einstein

4631.quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
4631.author: Thornton Wilder

4632.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
4632.author: Confucius

4633.quote: Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes, but few have the gift of penetration.
4633.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

4634.quote: Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.
4634.author: Epictetus

4635.quote: Nature takes away any faculty that is not used.
4635.author: William R. Inge

4636.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
4636.author: Rene Descartes

4637.quote: Wit lies in recognizing the resemblance among things which differ and the difference between things which are alike.
4637.author: Madame de Stael

4638.quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
4638.author: Benjamin Disraeli

4639.quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
4639.author: Benjamin Disraeli

4640.quote: To succeed, we must first believe that we can.
4640.author: Michael Korda

4641.quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
4641.author: Wayne Dyer

4642.quote: Be thankful when you don't know something for it gives you the opportunity to learn.

4643.quote: Any of us can achieve virtue, if by virtue we merely mean the avoidance of the vices that do not attract us.
4643.author: Robert Lynd

4644.quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
4644.author: Nora Roberts

4645.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive � to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
4645.author: Marcus Aurelius

4646.quote: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
4646.author: Michelangelo

4647.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
4647.author: Albert Einstein

4648.quote: A subtle thought that is in error may yet give rise to fruitful inquiry that can establish truths of great value.
4648.author: Isaac Asimov

4650.quote: Make the most of yourself for that is all there is of you.
4650.author: Ralph Emerson

4651.quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
4651.author: Buddha

4652.quote: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so too.
4652.author: Voltaire

4653.quote: If you propose to speak, always ask yourself, is it true, is it necessary, is it kind.
4653.author: Buddha

4654.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
4654.author: Lao Tzu

4655.quote: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
4655.author: Carl Jung

4656.quote: The only way to tell the truth is to speak with kindness. Only the words of a loving man can be heard.
4656.author: Henry Thoreau

4657.quote: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
4657.author: Albert Schweitzer

4658.quote: You block your dream when you allow your fear to grow bigger than your faith.
4658.author: Mary Morrissey

4659.quote: I never worry about action, but only inaction.
4659.author: Winston Churchill

4660.quote: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.
4660.author: Elbert Hubbard

4661.quote: Take it easy � but take it.
4661.author: Woody Guthrie

4662.quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
4662.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

4663.quote: The past has no power to stop you from being present now. Only your grievance about the past can do that.
4663.author: Eckhart Tolle

4664.quote: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.
4664.author: Dr. David M. Burns

4665.quote: We are not animals. We are not a product of what has happened to us in our past. We have the power of choice.
4665.author: Stephen Covey

4666.quote: Don't leave a stone unturned. It's always something, to know you have done the most you could.
4666.author: Charles Dickens

4667.quote: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. And today? Today is a gift that's why they call it the present.

4668.quote: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
4668.author: Richard Bach

4669.quote: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
4669.author: Confucius

4670.quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
4670.author: Richard Bach

4671.quote: He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
4671.author: Chinese proverb

4672.quote: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
4672.author: Sophocles

4673.quote: Every problem has a gift for you in its hands.
4673.author: Richard Bach

4674.quote: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.

4675.quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
4675.author: Margaret Fuller

4676.quote: The grand essentials of happiness are: something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
4676.author: Chalmers

4677.quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.

4678.quote: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
4678.author: Confucius

4679.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
4679.author: Rene Descartes

4680.quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
4680.author: Charles R. Swindoll

4681.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
4681.author: Ralph Emerson

4682.quote: Whenever something negative happens to you, there is a deep lesson concealed within it.
4682.author: Eckhart Tolle

4683.quote: I think somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
4683.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

4684.quote: To give ones self earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom.
4684.author: Confucius

4685.quote: Good timber does not grow with ease; the stronger the wind, the stronger the trees.

5404.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
