5405.quote: The future is completely open, and we are writing it moment to moment.
5405.author: Pema Chodron

5406.quote: More often than not, anger is actually an indication of weakness rather than of strength.
5406.author: Dalai Lama

5407.quote: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
5407.author: Julie Morgenstern

5408.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
5408.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

5409.quote: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
5409.author: Andy Warhol

5410.quote: He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
5410.author: Chinese proverb

5411.quote: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
5411.author: Abraham Lincoln

5412.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding about ourselves.
5412.author: Carl Jung

5413.quote: Mind is everything: muscle, pieces of rubber. All that I am, I am because of my mind.
5413.author: Paavo Nurmi

5414.quote: It isn't what happens to us that causes us to suffer; it's what we say to ourselves about what happens.
5414.author: Pema Chodron

5415.quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
5415.author: Haynes Bayly

5416.quote: We must become the change we want to see.
5416.author: Mahatma Gandhi

5417.quote: Good timber does not grow with ease; the stronger the wind, the stronger the trees.
5417.author: J. Willard Marriott

5418.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and the every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
5418.author: Anne Bronte

5419.quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
5419.author: Robert Brault

5420.quote: True happiness means forging a strong spirit that is undefeated, no matter how trying our circumstances.
5420.author: Daisaku Ikeda

5421.quote: We are the leaves of one branch, the drops of one sea, the flowers of one garden.
5421.author: Jean Lacordaire

5422.quote: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
5422.author: Oscar Wilde

5423.quote: What you are is what you have been. What you�ll be is what you do now.
5423.author: Buddha

5424.quote: Watch the little things; a small leak will sink a great ship.
5424.author: Benjamin Franklin

5426.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
5426.author: Lao Tzu

5427.quote: Being right is highly overrated. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.

5428.quote: We know from science that nothing in the universe exists as an isolated or independent entity.
5428.author: Margaret Wheatley

5429.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal: my strength lies solely in my tenacity
5429.author: Louis Pasteur

5430.quote: Ideals are an imaginative understanding of that which is desirable in that which is possible.
5430.author: Walter Lippmann

5431.quote: All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.
5431.author: Napoleon Hill

5432.quote: The greatest way to live with honour in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
5432.author: Socrates

5433.quote: I believe that we are fundamentally the same and have the same basic potential.
5433.author: Dalai Lama

5434.quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
5434.author: John Lennon

5436.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
5436.author: John Locke

5437.quote: Life a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of the future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
5437.author: Charles A. Lindbergh

5438.quote: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
5438.author: Napoleon Hill

5439.quote: Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
5439.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

5440.quote: In the long run we get no more than we have been willing to risk giving.
5440.author: Sheldon Kopp

5441.quote: We are Divine enough to ask and we are important enough to receive.
5441.author: Wayne Dyer

5442.quote: All the world is a stage, And all the men and women merely players.They have their exits and entrances; Each man in his time plays many parts.
5442.author: William Shakespeare

5443.quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
5443.author: Buddha

5444.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
5444.author: William White

5445.quote: You do not become good by trying to be good, but by finding the goodness that is already within you.
5445.author: Eckhart Tolle

5446.quote: When you lose, don't lose the lesson.

5447.quote: Worry gives a small thing a big shadow.

5448.quote: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
5448.author: Tony Robbins

5449.quote: A man of ability and the desire to accomplish something can do anything.
5449.author: Donald Kircher

5450.quote: My reputation grows with every failure.
5450.author: George Shaw

5451.quote: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.

5452.quote: The awareness of our own strength makes us modest.
5452.author: Paul Cezanne

5453.quote: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
5453.author: Lao Tzu

5454.quote: A good rest is half the work.

5455.quote: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty.
5455.author: Lao Tzu

5456.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
5456.author: Saint Augustine

5457.quote: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
5457.author: Julie Morgenstern

5458.quote: You do not become good by trying to be good, but by finding the goodness that is already within you.
5458.author: Eckhart Tolle

5459.quote: I think somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
5459.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

5460.quote: A man may fulfil the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer, and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
5460.author: Oliver Holmes

5461.quote: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
5461.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

5462.quote: Count your joys instead of your woes. Count your friends instead of your foes.

5463.quote: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
5463.author: Robert Fulghum

5464.quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
5464.author: William Shakespeare

5465.quote: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.
5465.author: Bruce Lee

5466.quote: Weve got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
5466.author: Walt Disney

5467.quote: You can adopt the attitude there is nothing you can do, or you can see the challenge as your call to action.
5467.author: Catherine Pulsifer

5468.quote: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
5468.author: Oprah Winfrey

5469.quote: A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be.
5469.author: Albert Einstein

5470.quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
5470.author: Aristotle

5471.quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
5471.author: Ken S. Keyes

5472.quote: When in doubt, tell the truth.
5472.author: Mark Twain

5473.quote: Think how hard physics would be if particles could think.
5473.author: Murray Gell-Mann

5474.quote: You are important enough to ask and you are blessed enough to receive back.
5474.author: Wayne Dyer

5475.quote: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.
5475.author: Carl Jung

5476.quote: They can do all because they think they can.
5476.author: Virgil

5477.quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
5477.author: Buddha

5478.quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world.
5478.author: Helen Keller

5479.quote: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.
5479.author: Dalai Lama

5480.quote: I believe that every person is born with talent.
5480.author: Maya Angelou

5481.quote: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
5481.author: Wayne Dyer

5482.quote: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.
5482.author: Tony Robbins

5483.quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
5483.author: Thomas Fuller

5484.quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
5484.author: Coco Chanel

5485.quote: The more you know yourself, the more you forgive yourself.
5485.author: Confucius

5486.quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change, and to preserve change amid order.
5486.author: Alfred Whitehead

5487.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
5487.author: Margaret Mead

5488.quote: Kind words will unlock an iron door.
5488.author: Turkish proverb

5489.quote: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
5489.author: Etty Hillesum

5490.quote: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
5490.author: Mark Twain

5491.quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
5491.author: Plutarch

5492.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
5492.author: Michael Jordan

5493.quote: Flow with whatever is happening and let your mind be free. Stay centred by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate.
5493.author: Chuang Tzu

5494.quote: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.
5494.author: Norman Peale

5495.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
5495.author: Jimmy Dean

5496.quote: The happiness that is genuinely satisfying is accompanied by the fullest exercise of our faculties and the fullest realization of the world in which we live.
5496.author: Bertrand Russell

5497.quote: Everyone should carefully observe which way his heart draws him, and then choose that way with all his strength.
5497.author: Hasidic saying

5498.quote: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.
5498.author: Edwin Markham

5499.quote: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
5499.author: Willa Cather

5500.quote: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgement.
5500.author: Ralph Marston

5501.quote: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
5501.author: Lao Tzu

5502.quote: We must become the change we want to see.
5502.author: Mahatma Gandhi

5503.quote: Life a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of the future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
5503.author: Charles A. Lindbergh

5504.quote: I have often regretted my speech, never my silence.
5504.author: Publilius Syrus

5505.quote: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
5505.author: Buddha

5506.quote: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
5506.author: Hermann Hesse

5507.quote: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
5507.author: Pablo Picasso

5508.quote: Patience is a virtue but you will never ever accomplish anything if you don't exercise action over patience.
5508.author: Byron Pulsifer

5509.quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
5509.author: Margaret Fuller

5510.quote: What you fear is that which requires action to overcome.
5510.author: Byron Pulsifer

5511.quote: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
5511.author: Abraham Lincoln

5512.quote: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyse you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
5512.author: Bernice Reagon

5513.quote: Think as a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
5513.author: William Yeats

5514.quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
5514.author: Mother Teresa

5515.quote: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
5515.author: Alan Watts

5517.quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
5517.author: Thomas Edison

5518.quote: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.
5518.author: Arthur Rubinstein

5519.quote: Excellence is to do a common thing in an uncommon way.
5519.author: Booker Washington

5520.quote: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
5520.author: Dalai Lama

5521.quote: The true way to render ourselves happy is to love our work and find in it our pleasure.
5521.author: Francoise de Motteville

5522.quote: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
5522.author: John Lubbock

5523.quote: He who experiences the unity of life sees his own Self in all beings, and all beings in his own Self, and looks on everything with an impartial eye.
5523.author: Buddha

5524.quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
5524.author: Jean de la Fontaine

5525.quote: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
5525.author: Robert Pirsig

5526.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough.
5526.author: Frank Crane

5527.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
5527.author: Rene Descartes

5528.quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
5528.author: Edward Gibbon

5529.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
5529.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

5530.quote: I believe that every person is born with talent.
5530.author: Maya Angelou

5531.quote: It is the quality of our work which will please God, not the quantity.
5531.author: Mahatma Gandhi

5532.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavours to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
5532.author: Henry David Thoreau

5533.quote: Sometimes the cards we are dealt are not always fair. However you must keep smiling and moving on.
5533.author: Tom Jackson
